name: Qbic Hotel Amsterdam WTC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I printed the directions on how to get to the Hotel, it would have been a bit confusing if I hadn't.
reviews.title: Pretty Cool, but for Singles ONLY!

likes.liked: — Very modern design, Cool lighting and lobby lounge
likes.disliked: — Storage space, no bathroom door, no place to leave soap in bathroom!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is ok, especially if all you're looking for is a place to sleep at night and be out most of the day. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a couple tho, there is no bathroom door, and very little storage space. All in all, you get your euros worth there. If I were to go to Ams again on business I would stay again, very easy as it is right next to WTC tram and Train Station.
reviews.title: Unique experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: What an experience! Very different stay to anywhere else. If you like ultra modern, minimalistic places, this is a great choie. Exceptioanlly clean and although our room was not big, they managed to make it look and feel spacious enough. Uncomparable value for money - we paid 39 Euros for a double room. This was of course excluding breakfast and I don't think such option exists in Qbic hotels as it is all about saving space and money in this little chain of hotels (hope it will grow soon as I'd be more than happy to stay in a place like that again).
reviews.title: A Great Find. GIve it a Go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was almost all in white plus some trendy black accessories and black&white photographs on the walls. One of the fantastic things was the light - you could program it to slowly change colours from green to blue, yellow, bright pink - very cool!
reviews.title: Relatively cheap boutique hotel, but certainly not for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was its location - Amsterdam World Trade Centre. Make sure you tell your taxi driver that you want to get to WTC and not to Qbic hotel as they may not know what you are talking about. Also, when you get there, it will not be obvious where the actual hotel is - you need to get inside the WTC building and if you don't normally pay attention to every detail around you, you may easily miss the arrows pointing you to the hotel. Best ask at the reception desk for help.
reviews.title: verry trendy

likes.liked: — cheap and close to town centre

reviews.title: Something that one would never expect
reviews.text: Dear fellow travellers,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am a business traveller in the creative industries, so this place was booked by my secretary because of some mentioning in Wallpaper or something of that sort. My stay will provide me with the most ridiculous travel story I have to tell and I want to share it with you and as many people as possible.
reviews.title: The Qbic was really fun to experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here you go: After realizing on late arrival in Amsterdam that I would have to go directly to my meeting and check in later I called Qbic and asked if that would be a problem, already being confused that the hotel seemed to be in a closed compound without direct street access and, very important for me, no obvious place where a cab should pick me up. Well needless to say I was told that check in at around 11pm would be no problem whatsoever. On trying to talk a cab driver into taking me to the WTC he adamantly wanted to tell me that there is no hotel in the compound and nevertheless proud me to an entrance to a very lifeless architectural structure. I rang a bell at 11.02pm, entered and the real story begins here. Finding the hotel in the empty, lifeless lobby-like structure is somewaht possible if you are brave enough to conquer a space that seems very empty and as if you are trespassing every step of the way. One can find the approximation of a reception though, eventually, I did around 11.10. It is all machines, very 2001, unfortunatedly the checkin machine was not working and I was refer to the clerk, who was nowhere to be seen. At around 11.15 I started to call the phone number on my reservation paper. I spoke to somebody in Maastricht who told me that the situation I was in would be impossible that I couldn't be all alone in that compound, yet: I was and after he was somewhat convinced of my desperate need for a bed and my right to have one due to the reservation numbers I gave to him, he gave me a telephone number to call. I did and was perplexed when the phone right next to me in the empty machinery scenery began to ring. I was so surpised to pick up....and hear myself on my cell. I called mastricht again, got another dose of disbelief and eventually a cell phone number. I called that number at around 11.30, wandering around in the empty modern wilderness, thinking about Jim Jarmush and Will Smith in I am Legend and thinking of hitting one of the sofas while waiting for someone to answer that cell phone. Well nobody did. It was Maastricht again, they told me to go back to start. 11.45. Now what do you do in the middle of nowhere with nowhere to go to. You think about your early flight out, 6.50 and how precious minutes of "sleep" are replaced by anxiety and amusement. And you swear that you will fire your secretary and tell everybody and their dog that Qbic is not a concept but a fraud. Obviously when thinking to oneself, one uses another kind of language, not advisable to rephrase those words here. So thoughts about home cross your mind, you look out of the windows into an outside that is as empty and desolated as the strange inside you have to share with...machines, nothing else, just things, ticking away. Ring, something like a elevatorbell from where the checkin machine was! You run back, and: a person welcomes you, sort of. Nice guy, you hate him immediatedly but he actually is so nice that you forgive him and go to the room taking the card from him and preparing yourself for what a hip hotel might be like. It is like a officers cabin on battlestar Galactica, maybe, with lights so that the junkies can't do the fix, kind of fancy.
reviews.title: Won't come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Well after 4 solid hour I begged for the nice person to have fullfilled my only dream, to organize a cab for me to take me to the airport. The cab was there, the driver asked what i was doing in the building this time of day, didn't want to belive that there is a hotel inside, I kind of got his drift and agreed and was happy thinking about home. Only downside to the ending: because there is no street, the cab charges you 7,50 Euro just for waiting in the noman's land for you. I gave them to him, even now I can hardly believe my welcome at the Qbic Amsterdam, why should he believe that there is a hotel at the WTC with guests who might go somewhere from nowhere?
reviews.title: Not what you´re used to.... even better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was asked if the stay was less than perfect, well, most certainly so! Do not even think about punishing the night clerk, he was the best thing in the whole bizarre scenario. I didn't fire my secretary either.
reviews.title: Expensive hotel with little to offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Qbic as part of a flight/hotel package deal. We specifically chose Qbic because it was closer to town than many of the other hotels on offer with the package.
reviews.title: We Love QBIC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Qbic rooms are very unique and very comfortable. We had a lovely time during our stay of three nights and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Unique, but not for the bashful..

likes.liked: — the price, unique room, free wifi
likes.disliked: — bit of a poorly designed bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was VERY comfortable, and due to the unique layout/design - the rooms are actually quite spacious despite its label as a pod hotel.
reviews.title: Unique, fun experiene!

likes.liked: — Unique atmosphere, retro-styled room with lights, easy access to tram, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The fact that there is not staff everywhere made this for a very private and quiet trip. (only usually one staff around if you need them, otherwise they come and bring fresh towels and soap each day). Also love the fact that there is a (free) safe in the room....
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

likes.liked: — Value for money for the given rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom is cool, best shower heads ever (they're huge!) and the beds are VERY comfortable.
reviews.title: Good concept but dirty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: For a visit to the theatric festival 'De Parade' I searched for a cheap hotel in Amsterdam. Qbic was intersting in price but specially in design. Although advertised as self-service there was a great staff who helped if neccesary.
reviews.title: Qbic: hip design and good value for mony

likes.disliked: — through a desolated WTC at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A pleasent stay for a pleasant price.
reviews.title: Qbic Hotel- a room with a difference..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were amazed by the big wtc building being so empty, we had to buzz ourselves in.
reviews.title: I'd Rather Go To Prison!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thought the hotel advertises as being a self service hotel, check in and check out using food machines, there was a very welcoming staff member who told us to ring him whenever we got stuck. The check in actually went easily.
reviews.title: Style on the budget - not keen on the toilet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once int the room we were amazed by the space and the furniture.. the Qubi. Looked realy cool and when we asked the staff member to change the lights he set all kinds of cool colours for us.
reviews.title: Good transport links, excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room feels spacious and the modern design has the wow factor. The sofa and the bed were really comfortable and had a great nights sleep. The shower was great but the bathroom 'pod' has neither a door nor a towell rack which isn't so great.
reviews.title: Not good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: The staff were dead friendly and the self service kiosks were ok and there's a microwave.
reviews.title: One-day trip to Amsterdam - very good!

likes.liked: — Service and design in the common areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: it's particular special to stay. decoration is extremely trendy. what is not so good is the fact that there is no door between toilet and rest of the room! less than 10 minutes from town centre. in the weekend very cheep. recommended for a short stay
reviews.title: Wierd, but good, overall

likes.liked: — Convenient location, clean, easy to use

description: Qbic Hotels, 'Cheap Chic & No Frills'. If you are a budget conscious traveler and you are looking for fun, sassy and efficient discount hotel accommodation. It is also close to schiphol airport making it an Amsterdam airport hotel as well.
